intro: Nemophila discoidalis, commonly known as the miniature bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, short hairs. Nemophila discoidalis is a short-lived perennial that produces seed capsules containing numerous tiny seeds.
